variables.input:
// filter timeseries by the selected cluster
fetch dt.entity.kubernetes_cluster
| fields entity.name
| sort entity.name asc

// used to navigate back to the kubernetes app
fetch dt.entity.kubernetes_cluster
| filter entity.name==$Cluster
| fields id

6.title: CPU Utilization

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - CPU usage • Kubernetes: Node - CPU allocatable

7.title: Memory Utilization

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - working set memory • Kubernetes: Node - memory allocatable

8.title: Pod Utilization

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Pod count • Kubernetes: Node - pod allocatable count

9.title: CPU Requests Commitment

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - CPU requests • Kubernetes: Node - CPU allocatable

10.title: Memory Requests Commitment

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - memory requests • Kubernetes: Node - memory allocatable

11.title: CPU Limits Commitment

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - CPU limits • Kubernetes: Node - CPU allocatable

12.title: Memory Limits Commitment

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - memory limits • Kubernetes: Node - memory allocatable

13.title: CPU Usage per Namespace

15.title: CPU Quota

19.title: Memory Usage per Namespace

20.title: Memory Quota

22.title: Receive Bandwidth

23.title: Transmit Bandwidth

25.title: Rate of Received Packets Dropped

26.title: Rate of Transmitted Packets Dropped

28.title: Rate of Received Errors

29.title: Rate of Transmitted Errors

31.title: Average Pod Bandwidth by Namespace: Received

32.title: Average Pod Bandwidth by Namespace: Transmitted

34.title: Network Usage
34.query:
// list a table by namespace with network statistics
timeseries {
  receiveData = sum(dt.kubernetes.pod.network_received_data),
  transmitData = sum(dt.kubernetes.pod.network_transmitted_data),
  receivePacketDrop = sum(dt.kubernetes.pod.network_received_packets_dropped),
  transmitPacketDrop = sum(dt.kubernetes.pod.network_transmitted_packets_dropped),
  receiveError = sum(dt.kubernetes.pod.network_received_errors),
  transmitError = sum(dt.kubernetes.pod.network_transmitted_errors)
}, 
// filter by the cluster selected 
filter: {
  k8s.cluster.name == $Cluster
}, by: { dt.entity.cloud_application_namespace, k8s.namespace.name },
from: -2m,
nonempty: true,
// show namespaces with missing timeseries, e.g. as there were no packets dropped.
union: true
| fieldsRemove interval, timeframe
| fieldsAdd receiveData = arrayFirst(receiveData)
| fieldsAdd transmitData = arrayFirst(transmitData)
| fieldsAdd receivePacketDrop = arrayFirst(receivePacketDrop)
| fieldsAdd transmitPacketDrop = arrayFirst(transmitPacketDrop)
| fieldsAdd receiveError = arrayFirst(receiveError)
| fieldsAdd transmitError = arrayFirst(transmitError)
| sort receiveData desc
| fieldsRename `Name` = k8s.namespace.name
, `Current Receive Bandwidth` = receiveData
, `Current Transmit Bandwidth` = transmitData
, `Rate of Received Packets Dropped` = receivePacketDrop
, `Rate of Transmitted Packets Dropped` = transmitPacketDrop
, `Rate of Received Errors` = receiveError
, `Rate of Transmitted Errors` = transmitError

categoricalBarChartSettings.valueAxisLabel: Current Receive Bandwidth,Current Transmit Bandwidth,Rate of Received Packets Dropped,Rate of Transmitted Packets Dropped,Rate of Received Errors,Rate of Transmitted Errors

35.content:
### Cluster: [$Cluster](/ui/intent/dynatrace.kubernetes/view-entity-dt.entity.kubernetes_cluster/#{"id":"$ClusterID"})
Get broad visibility into the scale, status, and resource usage of your Kubernetes clusters. If you don't see data, [start monitoring your cluster](/ui/apps/dynatrace.kubernetes/onboarding) or [explore this dashboard in our Playground](https://wkf10640.apps.dynatrace.com/ui/document/dynatrace.kubernetes.kubernetes-cluster)
